thread.title: Viral video of raging female cyclist lashing out at van full of catcalling builders goes viral - but eyewitnesses claim it was staged
thread.title_full: Viral video of raging female cyclist lashing out at van full of catcalling builders goes viral - but eyewitnesses claim it was staged

title: Viral video of raging female cyclist lashing out at van full of catcalling builders goes viral - but eyewitnesses claim it was staged
text:
The video went viral after the raging cyclist was seen tearing off the van’s wing mirror – but was all as it seemed? 
It was released by Shoreditch-based viral content firm Jungle Creations, co-owned by 26-year-old Jamie Bolding. 
But a witness has told The Sun that they saw Bolding giving instructions to actors before the scene was filmed by a motorcyclist on Monday. 
Builder Scott Deane claimed to The Sun: “I was across the road having a break and I saw this very attractive girl with a bike talking to a blonde guy who was giving her instructions. 
“Then three guys dressed in orange site clothes turned up in a van and the blonde bloke was giving them instructions too. 
“He was telling the girl: ‘You need to ride behind the van aggressively’. Viral Thread The female cyclist was seen being apparently subjected to a barrage of sexist comments Viral Thread After the woman appeared to be subjected to the harassment, she peddles furiously after the van to try and catch it Viral Thread She is seen ripping the wing mirror from the van after enduring the onslaught of disrespectful comments 
“They practiced the scene two or three times with the motorbike riding behind them. 
“You could see there was already damage to the wing mirror, it was loose. 
“It was in front of Rada so I just assumed it might be something to do with them. 
“I couldn’t believe it when I saw the video online.” Related Stories Dad-of-three cyclist dies after hitting six-inch pothole 'shoddily repaired' after months of complaints Pensioner bike smash Elderly cyclist dies in crash with parked car after 'losing control of his bike' in car park CORRIE HUNT Corrie McKeague witness found by cops who hope he may hold vital clues to where missing RAF man is HELP ME CHARLIE Cyclist almost paralysed after crash with Charlie Austin says only Prem ace knows what happened 'HE BEAT HER WORSE THAN AN ANIMAL' Ironman star ‘punches cyclist ex-wife at racing track in violent row over child support payments for their three kids’ 'YOU WANNA PICK UP YOUR LITTER?' Incredible moment a cyclist shamed a white van driver into picking up rubbish he left on the street 'SOUNDS QUITE RUDE' Police mocked for 'absurd' manoeuvre dubbed 'Dutch reach' aimed to make roads safer for cyclists HEAD-ON HORROR SMASH Shocking moment young motorcyclist slams into car windscreen in head-on crash 

Jungle Creations co-founder Paul Bieboer said the firm’s involvement in the video was just to “receive the content”. 
He added: “It’s a source we’ve never used before. 
“We’ve never worked with them before. As a company we’ve known them for a few years but never really licensed videos from them.” Viral Thread The apparent exchange was claimed to be captured on a following moped riders helmet cam Viral Thread The following motorcyclist sides with the cyclist 
Asked to clarify what Jungle Creations do, Mr Bieboer said: “We create videos and viral content.” 
He denied his firm created the road rage video – yet refused to hand over contact details of the person or company he sourced the clip from. 
On the Jungle Creation website, the company says its “viral video concepts” are created by their “award-winning in-house team”.
